word: After we had said our farewells,
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
